channel.title: E-cigs
channel.description:
I purchased a Vuse vapor pen a week or so ago, and it was awesome at first but eventually started to seem pretty pointless to use. I decided to get a pretty decent e-cig, along with a pretty nice flavor called "Hobbes' Blood". It has a very nice strawberry and watermelon flavor, with just a tiny bit of coconut. http://thevaporchef.com/products/hobbes-blood
Anyway, I was wondering if anyone else here has one. Also, what flavors do you like?

item.title: E-cigs

Ive lately been vaping 5ml a day with my Patriot RDA on Maraxus.
[/quote]

Damn son 5ml is quite a bit, I just bought a mini aspire nautilus today for 25$ and it holds 2ml. I love how you can change the air flow on them.[/quote]

Nice! I just broke my nautilus

item.title: E-cigs
item.dc:creator: @Stunninhigh Stunninhigh
item.description:
@Stunninhigh wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:66, topic:550259”][quote author=Archer link=topic=669170.msg4477751#msg4477751 date=1427204586]
Yes, it depends on how much you vape a day typically.
[/quote]
I’ve gotten to where I usually can vape a full tank of liquid (MELO cartomizer) in no more than 2 days.[/quote]

Thats about where I’m at, ill vape til it gets a lil hot and when it cools down I’m vaping again. I’ve went from smoking a little over a pack a day to about half a pack a day if that

Read full topic

item.title: E-cigs
item.dc:creator: @Stunninhigh Stunninhigh
item.description:
@Stunninhigh wrote:

[quote=“Soulcist, post:62, topic:550259”][quote author=Stunninhigh link=topic=669170.msg4477596#msg4477596 date=1427100582]

Just don’t understand the need for these, these costs more than cigarettes with a few little tweaks to them such as the colors that can be made for the things, and the flavors to make it more enjoyable (and so you don’t smell like shit of course). Are these even better than cigarettes?

What do you meen by better, and if you think about how much you spend on a pack of cigarettes a day depending on how much you smoke and one bottle of juice is like 11.99 depending where you go and what you buy. In my case one bottle of juice can last me quite a while if I dont smoke ridiculously. But yes it may be a tad more exspensive in the long run.
[/quote]
Sorry, I continue to forget that the prices of cigarettes are completely different by the state. For example, in Georgia, it ranges from $4-6 USD while in New York (and from what I heard of course) it ranges from $14-17 USD. I suppose where you live would making vaping more cost efficient.[/quote]

Damn cigarettes in NY are high but no here in Kentucky I smoke Marlboro Edge that range from 3.50 a pack to 4.20 a pack but I smoke a pack and a half a day so thats 10.5 packs a week which is a half a pack over a carton so im smoking 42$ a week thats about 170$ a month on cigarettes when i could probably spend 50$ a month on juice plus maybe a new coil which is 2.99. I think vaping is cheaper in the long run (Depending on where you live like you said)

Read full topic

item.title: E-cigs
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

Soulcist:

Just don’t understand the need for these, these costs more than cigarettes with a few little tweaks to them such as the colors that can be made for the things, and the flavors to make it more enjoyable (and so you don’t smell like shit of course). Are these even better than cigarettes?

I’m sure everyone has a reason for vaping. You can adjust the nicotine level you are taking in, as well as choose from a vast amount of flavors. In the end though, for those that put more money into this than the average person they are most likely just pursuing it as a hobby.

Read full topic

item.title: E-cigs
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

If you aren’t looking to make a hobby of vaping it should only be pricey to get a decent mod to use with batteries, RDA, and or tank. Then it is just liquid from there and how much you vape. One reason some mods are so expensive is the computer chip in them is so much more accurate at reading your voltage,watts, and battery life than other cheaper ones are. If you are just trying to quit cigs it would definitely save money.

Read full topic

item.title: E-cigs
item.dc:creator: @Fox2007 Fox2007
item.description:
@Fox2007 wrote:

Heres mine, but these are more on the expensive end. Cost me $120 for the box, $24 for 2 Samsung batteries, and $25 for the Infinite CLT RDA, plus i have a bunch of other stuff such as several RDA’s and a custom box i built myself.

IPV3 by Pioneer4you

Ranges from 7watts to 165watts, and can read all the way down to 0.08 ohms.

Read full topic

item.title: E-cigs
item.dc:creator: @PrivateDamn PrivateDamn
item.description:
@PrivateDamn wrote:

In my opinion, the best E-Liquid (Or E-Juice, whatever fancies your taste) is SpaceJam. It’s a brand, but any Juice they have is amazing. I used to go to a store here where I live, and they let me test different drippers, mods, e-cigs, and they would let me take them home for a couple of days (or weeks depending on the price of the mod/cig) to test it out and see how long the coils/setup would last. They ALWAYS had me try out different SpaceJam liquids just to see which ones were the best (and to be honest, I could never find a favorite because every time I did, I’d find a new one with the next batch.)

Cheers!

Read full topic

item.title: E-cigs
item.dc:creator: @Stunninhigh Stunninhigh
item.description:
@Stunninhigh wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:49, topic:550259"][quote author=Stunninhigh link=topic=669170.msg4477288#msg4477288 date=1426775433]
It has more than just one ‘dangerous’ chemical, not sure if your aware of what formaldehyde is but its a big cancer causing chemical, and for it to produce 15times more than regular cigs… Seems to me like your just killing yourself off, I know regular cigs kill you just as much but if Vaping is to why even stop smoking cigs? Sure as hell wont do both. Just saying I know several people and friends that have quit vaping because of this, do some more reseach you’ll find more stuff about the famous “E-cigs”
[/quote]
I know what formaldehyde is, I read about it before purchasing e-cigs. But I still think it’s better than the tar and chemicals of real cigarettes. I personally am not going to permanently be vaping, it’s just a way to get rid of the habit of smoking real cigarettes. In fact, I have noticed that I tend to vape less than I smoke, because when you smoke real cigarettes you need to smoke the whole thing or it will taste like shit next time you light it up.

[quote]In the experiments, mice exposed to e-cigarette fumes suffered mild damage to their lungs and became far more susceptible to respiratory infections.

Their immune responses to both viruses and bacteria were weakened by such an extent that two out of ten animals died.[/quote]

Real cigarettes do the exact same thing afaik.[/quote]

Yes real cigarettes do the same I’m sure, but as I was saying we know the long-term effects of cigarettes nobody knows the long-term effects from vaping.

But on topic, after doing some more research and reading about all the thousands of poisons in cigarettes and the few in Vaping I decided to buy me a couple new coils for my cig and bought some liquid called Space Rockz (A sweet and fruity strawberry kiwi pop rocks candy) 18mg of nicotine and its really good. I still smoke cigarettes but I dont smoke as much when I Vape.

Read full topic

item.title: E-cigs
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

The studies saying ecigs create formaldehyde are done in unrealistic situations. You would have to vape one cigarettes worth in one hit which is impossible. That is the main gist of a two page study I read at work as the question is asked a lot. Just like you can’t vape one cigs worth in one hit, you cannot smoke a cig in one hit as you would choke at the least. No worries.

Read full topic

item.title: E-cigs
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

In reality, everything is bad for you. Okay.
Water - Too much can make you sick, too much can kill you, you can drown in it, when cold can cause frostbite, when hot can burn, etc.
Literally, everything. Even the air you breath can kill you. So, lets get off the topic of “OMG THIS IS BAD FOR YOU, DON’T DO IT” because, frankly, I (and most others) don’t give a shit.

Read full topic

item.title: E-cigs
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

No of course nobody adds it. Formaldehyde can be a by product created in the vaping process due to the ingredients used to make the liquid which is often cheap shit ejuice. Use of different, more expensive ingredients that do not cause formaldehyde is what I mean by saying we do not have it in our juices without saying something I am not supposed to say. Same goes for another local company with e juice twice the price of ours cause they use ingredients that wont create the formaldehyde by product and I have no clue what is in theirs. Vaping no matter what is used or created as a by product from how much you vape and voltage used is going to be safe. It is best to not smoke or vape.

Read full topic

item.title: E-cigs
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Are we all speaking different languages or something? I’m not saying ecigs or normal cigs are good or bad I’m saying that this whole formaldehyde issue has nothing to do with whether or not the supplier adds it. Because that would be completely retarded.

Read full topic
